titles.title: Approach, My Soul, the Mercy Seat

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Approach, my soul, the mercy seat, where Jesus answers pray'r; there humbly fall before His feet, for none can perish there.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Thy promise is my only plea, with this I venture nigh; Thou callest burdened souls to Thee, and such, O Lord, am I.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Bowed down beneath a load of sin, by Satan sorely pressed, by wars without, and fears within, I come to Thee for rest.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Be Thou my shield and hiding place, that, sheltered near Thy side, I may my fierce accuser face, and tell him, "Thou hast died."

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: O wondrous love, to bleed and die, to bear the cross and shame, that guilty sinners such as I, might plead Thy gracious name.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: "Poor tempest-toss√®d soul, be still, my promised grace receive"; 'tis Jesus speaks; I must, I will, I can, I do believe.
